intro: Tarrietia erythrosiphon subsp. leiocalyx, commonly known as the red-siphon tarrietia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly waxy texture. This subspecies is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky outcrops.
